message: I know there was a code snippet awhile back, but it's expired. And I know there was a mention of urls.py. Just trying to figure out the best and "more" right way to do it.
What are you planning on using Redis for?
this might be what you are talking about. https://gist.github.com/609238
@seanbrant yes, that's part of it. Thanks! But where we would you then use that file?

@unbracketed -- sorry... to be more specific. Using redis to collect analytics (like number of search views or models saved or a certain view accessed). Then also with some database issues. I need to manage multiple auto-incremented keys (with multiple ranges) per table (something MySQL doesn't support) and so using redis to manage those increment values.
I think I mentioned this last time, but storing the redis client in a thread local is unnecessary since it is itself a thead local (if you are using eventlet it would still be needed though).
